Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> making things add up to 100% is not really possible, and the z2z number needs to be subtracted from the other percentages. Lots of little things, but the code does seem to work, and gives so many stats

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> "shielded_paymentrate": 0.001048498827538829, means 3.75 zxtns/hour on the Hush chain, on average, over the last 30 days

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> This is the first time we have ever had any real statistics

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Compared to a total of 42 xtns/hour that the Hush chain does in total (including zxtns)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and you can call this RPC, giving it any number of blocks. The default # of blocks is 30 days

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX things are coming down the line ^^^

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ITM> so u can have any number of days?
What if I want daily, weekly, monthly, yearly? (I know I could store it in database daily)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM you give the RPC the amount of blocks in the "window"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Arguments:
1. nblocks   (numeric, optional) Number of blocks in averaging window.
2. blockhash (string, optional) The hash of the block which ends the window.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM so you can ask for stats like "the 30 days before and including this block"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> very powerful, allows looking at history in a sliding window

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> or you can change your window size to 1 hour or 1 day/etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I keep stats on transactions and payments, of all flavors: Shielding, Deshielding, Full Shielded or any of the previous (Shielded)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and then you can make so many stats from those basic data points

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Currently i am wondering if i should keep track of coinbase stuff, otherwise it's not possible to isolate that data, or subtract it out, which could give some interesting numbers

Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> % shielded is always going to be a low %, if you count all taddr coinbase
